compliance_reasoning: The regulation specifically addresses the recording of telephone conversations with consumers, requiring regulated entities to inform consumers at the outset of a conversation that it is being recorded. The document provided is a pension life cover scheme rules document that outlines the structure, definitions, and operation of a company pension scheme. There is no content in the document that relates to telephone conversations, call recording procedures, or customer communications protocols. The document is focused on defining the scheme rules rather than operational procedures for customer interactions.
regulation_text: 63. A regulated entity shall ensure that, where it intends to keep a record of a telephone conversation with a consumer, the regulated entity informs the consumer, at the outset of the conversation, that the telephone conversation is being recorded.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
